message.content:
cs.SD, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.MM, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with separation of sound sources using multichannel non-negative matrix factorization (NMF) and acoustic tracking. This involves signal processing, machine learning, and optimization techniques, which are commonly found in the sub-categories of cs.SD (Sound and Music Computing) and cs.SI (Speech and Natural Language Processing). The paper also proposes a novel multichannel NMF model, which involves matrix factorization and optimization, and hence could be relevant to the sub-category of cs.MM (Multimedia). Additionally, the paper evaluates the proposed method using established objective separation criteria, which could be relevant to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning).
